text: Streptophyta () is a clade of plants. Every living green plant is a streptophyta. This includes all land plants and freshwater green algae. == Definition == Different sources classify Streptophyta differently.http://www.protisten.de/german/docs/Phylogeny_in_Streptophyta.pdf Some include more organism groups, and others include fewer. Streptophyta organisms are both unicellular and multicellular. They reproduce sexually through conjugation.{Kapraun, D. F. (2007). Nuclear DNA content estimates in green algal lineages: Chlorophyta and Streptophyta. Annals of botany, 99(4), 677-701. Liang, Z., Geng, Y., Ji, C., Du, H., Wong, C. E., Zhang, Q., ... & Yu, H. (2020). Mesostigma viride genome and transcriptome provide insights into the origin and evolution of Streptophyta. Advanced Science, 7(1), 1901850. Nedelcu, A. M., Borza, T., & Lee, R. W. (2006). A land plantâ€“specific multigene family in the unicellular Mesostigma argues for its close relationship to Streptophyta. Molecular Biology and Evolution, 23(5), 1011-1015. Oliveira, I. B. D., Bicudo, C. E. D. M., & Moura, C. W. D. N. (2013). First records of Zygnematales (Zygnematophyceae, Streptophyta) for the state of Bahia, Brazil. Acta Botanica Brasilica, 27(4), 743-750.} == Phylogeny == Below are all of the relations of Streptophyta. == References == * Bremer, K. (1985) Summary of green plant phylogeny and classification. Cladistics 1:369-385. * * == Other websites == * The plant tree of life: an overview and some points of view * The closest land plants relatives Category:Plant taxonomy
